intro: Comanthera centauroides, commonly known as the centaur's leg, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
